item.title: Rensselaer Student to Explore Whether Jupiter Moon Can Support Life
item.description: Brianna Casey ’26 is one of 40 undergraduate students nationwide to be selected for NASA’s Europa Inspiring Clipper: Opportunities for Next-Generation Scientists, or ICONS, internship program. The program, which supports the Europa Clipper mission with the goal of determining whether Jupiter’s moon, Europa, has “conditions suitable to support life,” and matches students with mentors for ten weeks to conduct research.

item.title: RPI in the News: An AI-assisted commencement and blending art with tech
item.description: In the first segment in this episode of WAMC’s “The Best of Our Knowledge” radio program, host Lucas Willard and Jim Hendler, Director of the Future of Computing Institute at Rensselaer, discuss how Rensselaer’s bicentennial Commencement ceremony will feature special guest Emily Warren Roebling, brought to life with the help of artificial intelligence technology.

item.title: 7th Annual Lavender Graduation to be Held May 16
item.description: Date: Thursday, May 16, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:30 PM - All are invited to join the Rensselaer LGBTQ+ Task Force to celebrate the accomplishments of our LGBTQ+ graduates! The event will feature guest speaker Ray Lutzky ’02, PhD ’14, VP of Strategic Partnerships at Element451. Graduating students, please register if you plan to attend; contact the LGBTQ TaskForce if you have any questions.

item.title: HASS to Hold “DE-FENCE Part 2” Living Art Installation May 18
item.description: Join Rensselaer’s School of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences from 1pm to 4pm on Saturday, May 18 for “DE-FENCE Part 2: The Line Becomes a Territory,” as Margaretha Haughwout leads participants in the creation of DE-FENCE, a living participatory art installation at the NATURE Lab, located at 3319 6th Avenue in downtown Troy.

item.title: Every Day Matters: Optimism for the Future: Kamilia Nicolas
item.description: Kamilia Nicolas ’24 thrives in high-pressure environments. A senior at Rensselaer, Nicolas was class president when she entered college in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, managing to lead the freshmen and work with the university administration through the then unknown territory. She also flourished as an intern in the New Jersey Assembly and the New York City Council. But planning the Capital Region’s first-ever Youth Climate Career Summit has been her most challenging opportunity to date.

item.title: HelioCampus Syllabus Available for Summer Term
item.description:
Rensselaer faculty should note that the HelioCampus (formerly known as AEFIS) syllabus module will be available to access for the Spring Term on April 29. Based on the requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published by June 3; HelioCampus will publish the syllabi automatically on June 10.
